title.narrative: Provision of emergency latrine and shower facilities and repair of water supply infrastructures in support to the people affected by the Mosul crisis

description.narrative:
The proposed project aims to provide emergency water and sanitation support to vulnerable people affected by military operations in Mosul. The project is composed of two key activities: (1) First-line response to supply safe drinking water by installing/rehabilitating key water supply network and water treatment units in Mosul and/or surrounding areas and (2) Second-line response to ensure needs of female and people with disabilities are better addressed in existing camps/emergency sites by installing emergency latrines and shower facilities.
Under the first activity, UN-Habitat will rehabilitate up to 1 kilometers of water supply network, up to 2 water treatment units depending on level of damages, and install/rehabilitate critical water equipment such as water tanks, taps, pumps and valves in key locations in Mosul and/or surrounding areas as identified in coordination with the WASH Cluster. Activities will be prioritized in close collaboration with the WASH Cluster and might be modified depending on emergencies at the field level
Under the second activity, UN-Habitat will install 80 emergency latrines and shower facilities in camps/emergency sites. UN-Habitat will prioritize a gap filling strategy by targeting primarily females and people with disabilities in locations with a shortage of sanitation facilities. This will result in enhancing protection and dignity for women, girls and people with disabilities, while supporting attainment of minimum WASH standards.
UN-Habitat strategy is to keep as much flexibility as possible in order to implement activities in areas with the largest needs. In that regard, coordination with the WASH Cluster and other WASH partners will be central in the determination of target locations and activities.
The project will directly benefit 64,000 vulnerable people, including 17,850 women, 14,350 men, 17,775 girls and 14,025 boys in Mosul and/or surrounding area, including 4,000 through provision of emergency latrines and shower facilities : 70 latrines /shower for 3,500 people (1,750 women, 1,750 girls) and 10 latrines/shower for 500 people with disabilities (100 women, 350 men, 25 girls and 25 boys)
